title: Mushroom, caramelized onion, and ricotta frittata
directions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat and brown onions for 10 minutes.
Add mushrooms and sauté for about 5 minutes. Season.
Add the spinach at the last moment and cook until slightly wilted. Set aside.
Butter the slices of bread and place them in a 23-cm (9-in.) square baking dish. Divide slices evenly to cover bottom of pan.
Top bread with onion, spinach, and ricotta mixture.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and ricotta; pour over the vegetable mixture.
Top with a layer of grated cheddar.
Bake in oven for 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted into centre comes out clean.
Place under the broiler for 5 minutes.
ingredients: 750 mL (3 cups) thinly sliced onion (about 2 onions)
1 container (227 g) cremini or button mushrooms, thinly sliced
500 mL (2 cups) packed baby spinach (about 50 g)
30 mL (2 tbsp.) butter at room temperature
375 mL (1½ cups) grated old cheddar (about 100 g)
